description.narrative: This project will design and implement a comprehensive intervention strategy to improve the living conditions of conflict survivors and promoting individual, family and community resilience in Colombia. The project’s comprehensive transformative strategy is people-centered and context-specific and recognizes individual's and communities’ capacities to implement psychosocial support and mental health activities, build peace, and reduce violence on the one hand, while also creating alternative local development activities, promoting solidarity, and building a circular and care economy on the other. The project focuses its efforts in municipalities with Territorial Approach to Development Programs, and on groups that have historically suffered from victimizing acts and violence including women, youth, people with disabilities, LGBTI population, ethnic groups and peasant communities. Priority is given to design methodologies that promote peer learning, co-design, empowerment of local knowledge, horizontal education, circles of care, experiential learning, exchanges of knowledge, one-to-one mentoring, and the use of artistic and communication tools, among others.
